info.title: ZEDEDA Orchestrator Service
info.description: The ZEDEDA Orchestrator Service is part of ZEDEDA Edge Orchestration Platform. Orchestrator service defines the user facing APIs to interact with a third-party client (e.x. Azure, Rancher).

get.summary: Get API usage statistics
get.description: Get API usage statistics for given Enterprise or for all Enterprises.

400.description: Bad Request. The API gateway did not process the request because of missing parameter or invalid value of parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. The API gateway did not process the request because it lacks valid authentication credentials for the target resource. The request header has either no authorization details or an authorization that has been refused.

403.description: Forbidden. The API gateway did not process the request because the requestor does not have application level access permission for the operation or does not have access scope to the project.

500.description: Internal Server Error. The API gateway experienced an unexpected condition. Specific error condition is indicated in error codes.

504.description: Gateway Timeout. The API gateway did not receive a timely response from an upstream microservice it needed to communicate with in order to complete the request.

parameters.name: enterpriseIDs
parameters.description: If not specified, usage stats for the entire cluster are returned. If Enterprise IDs are specified, only stats specific to the enterprise list are returned.

parameters.name: userAgents
parameters.description: If not specified, usage stats for all the user agents are returned. If user agents are specified, only stats specific to the user agents are returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: System defined universally unique Id of the cluster instance

name.description: User defined name of the cluster instance, unique across the enterprise. Once cluster instance is created, name can’t be changed

title.description: User defined title of the cluster instance. Title can be changed at any time

description.description: Detailed description of the cluster instance

tags.description: Tags are name/value pairs that enable you to categorize resources. Tag names are case insensitive with max_length 512 and min_length 3. Tag values are case sensitive with max_length 256 and min_length 3.

projectId.description: project id which the given cluster instance belong to

clusterPolicyId.description: System defined universally unique Id of the cluster policy

edgeNodePoolTags.description: edgeNodePoolTags are name/value pairs that enables us to identify edgeNodes which are part of a ClusterInstance. Tag names are case insensitive with max_length 512 and min_length 3. Tag values are case sensitive with max_length 256 and min_length 3.

serverAppInst.description: app instance object for server node
serverAppInst.title: Cluster config details

agentAppInst.description: app instance object for agent node

minEdgeDevices.description: Minimum number of edge device required for the cluster instance

maxEdgeDevices.description: Maximum number of edge device allowed in the cluster instance

minServerNodes.description: Minimum number of server nodes required for the cluster instance

maxServerNodes.description: Maximum number of server nodes allowed in the cluster instance

minAgentNodes.description: Minimum number of agent nodes required for the cluster instance

maxAgentNodes.description: Maximum number of agent nodes allowed in the cluster instance

callHomeURL.description: CallHome URL for the cluster to fetch configuration details

orchestratorPluginID.description: System defined universally unique Id of the orchestrator plugin

netInstConfig.description: Network instance config to enforce on all devices of this cluster

orchestratorClusterURL.description: Href for the third-party cluster object.

dbEndpoint.description: External DataBase endpoint for the server to communicate and sync

devIds.description: List of Edge Node Ids to deploy the cluster instance

loc.description: Ordered pair of (latitude, longitude) separated by comma (,). Latitude is the horizontal component used for geographic positioning; it is the angle between 0° (the equator) and ±90° (north or south) at the poles measured in decimal degrees. It is the first value in an ordered pair. A negative number denotes a location south of the equator; a positive number is north. Longitude is the vertical component used for geographic positioning; it is the angle between 0° (the Prime Meridian) and ±180° (westward or eastward) measured in decimal degrees. It is the second number in an ordered pair. A negative number indicates a location west of Greenwich, England; a positive number east.

forwardLldp.description:
Enables forwarding of LLDP (Link Layer Discovery Protocol) frames across this
network instance.
LLDP is used by devices to advertise identity and capabilities to directly
connected neighbors, and is often required for topology discovery and network
management tools.
When enabled, LLDP frames (EtherType 0x88cc) are not dropped or suppressed
by the forwarding plane.

commonConnectivityProbeMethod.description:
User-defined method to use to determine the connectivity status.

 - CONNECTIVITY_PROBE_METHOD_UNSPECIFIED: Connectivity probing method is not specified and therefore will not be used.

 - CONNECTIVITY_PROBE_METHOD_TCP: Try to establish TCP connection with the probed endpoint to determine the connectivity
status.

commonNetworkConfigOrigin.description:
NetworkConfigOrigin enumerates all possible origins of a network port configuration.

 - NETWORK_CONFIG_ORIGIN_UNSPECIFIED: Unknown or unset origin.
 - NETWORK_CONFIG_ORIGIN_CONTROLLER: Config received from the controller.
 - NETWORK_CONFIG_ORIGIN_BOOTSTRAP: Initial device config embedded in the EVE installer, signed by the controller.
 - NETWORK_CONFIG_ORIGIN_OVERRIDE: Manually created JSON config injected into the installer.
 - NETWORK_CONFIG_ORIGIN_LASTRESORT: Fallback configuration automatically generated to enable DHCP on all Ethernet ports.
Used when no network config is available or when "network.fallback.any.eth" is enabled
and none of the existing configs provide controller connectivity.
 - NETWORK_CONFIG_ORIGIN_TUI: Config entered via the terminal UI (TUI).
 - NETWORK_CONFIG_ORIGIN_LOC: Configuration signed by the controller and delivered through the
Local Operator Console (LOC) in an air-gapped environment.
 - NETWORK_CONFIG_ORIGIN_LPS: Config changes made locally through the Local Profile Server (LPS).

origin.description: Indicates where EVE obtained the network config.

submittedAt.description:
Timestamp when this port’s configuration was originally submitted
or created at its source.

Meaning depends on the origin:
- Controller, LOC, bootstrap: timestamp provided by the controller.
- Local override.json: when the file was first loaded by EVE.
- Last-resort: when EVE generated the fallback config.
- LPS modifications: when the modified config was received.
- TUI: when the user submitted the configuration.

This is different from DevicePortStatus.timePriority, which is used
to compare and prioritize different sources of network configuration
(and may be synthetic for some sources, e.g. year 2000 for override.json,
epoch 0 for last-resort). By contrast, submitted_at represents when this
port’s configuration first came into existence, regardless of when or whether
the device applied it.

Note: this is a per-port timestamp. The underlying network config may
cover multiple ports, but only the portion relevant to this port is
reflected here.

commonPortConfigSource.description:
PortConfigSource describes the origin of the configuration used for a network port.
It helps distinguish between controller-provided, locally-modified, or initial configs.
